description.html: Spells have power, a fact clearly understood by wizards in their earliest days of study. But what few wizards realize is that the first time a spell is created, there comes into being a special power imbuing that spell with sentience. Few spellbooks have survived from the eras when new spells were written regularly but some have survived, and it is unwise to attempt to read them, so long after their creators became unable to suppress their power.

Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, you gain great power from the spells that inhabit your mind, however it is not entirely your own.

Sourcery Dice. You have four sourcery dice, which are d4s. A sourcery die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your sourcery dice when you finish a long rest. Whenever you cast a wizard spell, you can use a sourcery die, roll it and add the result to a single spell attack roll, or subtract the result from a single creatures saving throw roll. If you roll the maximum value, roll on the Sourcery Deviation table.

description.html: Also at 2nd level, whenever you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can recover a sourcery die instead of a first level spell slot.

description.html: Starting at 6th level, you gain two additional Sourcery Die increasing the maximum you can have to six.
At 10th level, your Sourcery Die increases to a d6.

At 14th level, when you finish a short rest, you may choose a Sourcery Deviation from the table.

The next time you roll on the Sourcery Deviation table, you may instead use the chosen effect.

You can use this feature once per short rest.
